pageContext.description: This axe is in good condition with very slight damage to the cutting edge. Low stop-ridge. Wide and convex cutting edge.
pageContext.other: Length: 5 1/10 ins. = 129.54mm,Width: Across cutting edge 3 1/4 ins. = 82.55mm,Weight: 12 oz. = 340.194 gms
pageContext.associations: Found in peaty soil which had come down from the topsoil overlying the limstone rock.
pageContext.publications: See Trans. Cumb. and West. Ant. and Arch. Soc. (N.S.), XXXVI.142.Fig.1 (This is a good photograph).,(Wringly shown in the title as being in Tulke House Museum, whereas they remained in Col. North's possession.)
pageContext.collection: The late Col. O. H. North DSO,Clifford Hall,Yealand Conyers,Nr. Carnforth, Lancs.,Now in Mrs. North's possession (Jan 1962). Following Mrs. North's death, in possession of Lt. Col. Brian North, same address.
pageContext.site: England,Cumbria (Westmoreland),Holmepark Quarries,Holme,Found in the debris after blasting.,27 June 1935
pageContext.toSearch: Holme Park Quarry, Burton-in-kendal, Carnforth, Cumbria La6 1nz, UK
pageContext.remarks: Compiler: Clare C. Fell 16.1.62. I have not been again to see this axe which I saw shortly after Coloner North died, so cannot give the thickness.
